class.name: Dragon Mage

default: (a) 2 daggers or (b) 1 sling and a bag of sling ammunition

classFeatures.name: Spellcasting
entries: Drawing on the ancient powers of dragons, you can cast spells to shape that essence to your will and express your prowess with the arcane over all others

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from your available spell lists based on your Draconian Origin. You learn additional Dragon Mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Dragon Mage table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Dragon Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these Dragon Mage spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of Dragon Mage spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the Dragon Mage spell list. When you do so, choose a number of Dragon Mage spells equal to your Spell Casting Ability modifier + your Dragon Mage level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level Dragon Mage, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Spellcasting Ability of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell Burning Hands, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma or Intelligence of your choosing is your spellcasting ability for your Dragon Mage spells, since your magic can draw from the soul of a Dragon and can naturally grow stronger or you can study the arcane and master it through your wits alone. You use one of these abilities whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your spellcasting ability modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Dragon Mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a Dragon Mage spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an arcane focus or a component as a spellcasting focus for your Dragon Mage spells.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Origins
entries: Beginning at 1st Level you choose one chromatic or metallic dragon; this color dragon will be where your power comes from. You gain features depending on this color. In addition you gain a Spellcasting List depending on the color chosen. You are also able to speak, read, and write Draconic. Some of your Draconian Abilities will require a saving throw, the DC for that will equal your Spell Save DC.
Red:

You have resistance to fire damage, at 10th level this becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, the creature will be wreathed in flames that will deal fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute. They can repeat their saving throws at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature can spend their action putting out the flames, ending the effect early.
Blue:

You have resistance to lightning damage, at 10th level this becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning damage, you gain an additional 10 ft. to your movement speed and your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity each of these effects ending at the end of your turn. Additionally each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Constitution Saving Throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.
Green:

You have resistance to poison damage, at 10th level this becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that would deal poison damage, each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature suffers a -2 to AC and a -10 ft. to its movement speed.
Black:

You have resistance to acid damage, at 10th level this becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that would deal acid damage, each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save you can choose either any non-magical armor or a non-magical weapon they are carrying, roll a d100 to determine what happens to said selected item. The higher stages inherit the lower stages’ effects.

1-10 : The item is damaged, the next time they crit fail to attack or a critical hit is imposed onto them  the item will break. 11-20 : The item receives a -2 penalty to either AC or to Attack Rolls. 21-30 : The item becomes unwieldy, giving them disadvantage on ability checks while holding the weapon or wearing the armor. 31-40 : The target has disadvantage on attack rolls while wielding the weapon, or disadvantage on saving throws while wearing the armor. 41-50 : While the item is equipped they suffer a -2 penalty to damage rolls. 51-60 : While the item is equipped they have disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws. 61-70 : While the item is equipped they take 1d6 acid damage at the start of their turns. 71-80 : In 1 minute, the item will be destroyed as it melts away by the acid. 81-90 : In 30 seconds, the item will snap in two, becoming either an improvised weapon, or unusable armor. 91-100 : The item is instantly destroyed and they take 4d6 acid damage.
White:

You have resistance to cold damage, at 10th level it becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage, you gain 10 temporary hit points until the start of your next turn. Each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Dexterity Saving Throw, on a failed save they are coated with ice, making their movement speed 0 and their attack rolls are made at a disadvantage until the start of your next turn. If they were in mid flight and failed the save, they fall to the ground and take fall damage as per normal.
Copper:

You have resistance to acid damage, at 10th level it becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals acid damage, the ground beneath you in a 15 ft radius becomes difficult terrain. While a creature other than yourself moves within this terrain they take 1d6 acid damage for every 5ft they move.
Bronze:

You have resistance to lightning damage, at 10th level it becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning damage, a burst of electricity blasts out from your hands in a 15 ft radius sphere. Each creature within the sphere, excluding yourself, takes 1d6 lightning damage and must make a Strength Saving Throw. On a failed save they are pushed back 15 ft.
Brass:

You have resistance to fire damage, at 10th level it becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, red gas exudes from your hands in a 15 ft radius sphere. Each creature, excluding yourself within the gas takes 1d6 fire damage and must pass a Constitution Saving throw, falling unconscious on a failed save. The creature(s) reawaken if they take any damage, or if another creature spends their action to wake them.
Silver:

You have resistance to cold damage, at 10th level it becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage, icy cold winds blow outward from your body in a 15 ft radius. Each creature within range takes 1d6 cold damage and must make a Constitution Saving Throw, suffering a -2 penalty to their AC and disadvantage on dexterity checks and saving throws on a failed save until the end of your next turn.
Gold:

You have resistance to fire damage, at 10th level it becomes immunity. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, fire flares out in a 15 ft radius sphere. Each creature takes 1d6 fire damage and must make a Strength Saving Throw, suffering disadvantage on all Strength Checks, Saving Throws, and attacks using Strength until the start of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Scales
entries: Being a Dragon Mage, your body is riddled with dragon scales, making your skin tougher. At 1st level While not wearing armor you have a natural armor equal to 13 + your Dexterity Modifier.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Archetype
entries: There are many variations of Dragon Mages, Summoners who call upon the help of an inner spirit to come to their aid, Devoted whose magic is brought upon the study or worship of either Tiamat or Bahamut, Evokers who imbue power into their allies, and Primordials who further enhance their elemental attunement.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Powers
entries: Also at 2nd level you learn the ancient secrets of dragons. You know how they can fly, shoot fire - lighting - acid - even frost out of their mouths. You start off with 3 Draconian Powers and gain more as shown in the Dragon Mage table. Some Draconian Powers are locked away by prerequisites that must be met before they obtain any of these sacred powers such as level and Draconian Origins. You can exchange a Draconian Power for others every time you level up.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Awakening
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as an action you can awaken ancient powers from within, maximizing your magical prowess. Once your Draconian Awakening ends, you suffer 1 level of exhaustion and cannot cast spells for 1 round. You cannot use this transformation until you finish a long rest. You gain more uses of this feature per long rest at 7th, 13th, and 17th levels. When you transform, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute :
You gain advantage on Saving Throws against spells and other magical effects, including a Dragon’s Breath Weapon.

If you have a flying speed, it increases by 30 ft. If you do not have a flying speed, you gain a flying speed of 40 ft. Until you reach 5th level, you cannot end your turn airborne, any attempt to do so causes you to fall.
You reduce the amount of damage you take from spells and other magical effects by 1d10. You can only do so once per round.
You increase the amount of damage dealt by your spells and other magical effects by 1d10. You can only do so once per round.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Recovery
entries: At 5th level, you have learned to regain some of your magical energy by pulling power out from the depths of your draconian soul. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your Dragon Mage level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.
For example, if you're a 5th-level Dragon Mage, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots. You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, gain a feature from your chosen Draconian Archetype

classFeatures.name: Draconian Awakening (x2)
entries: At 7th level, Gain another use of Draconian Awakening

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Spell Expertise
entries: Starting at 9th level, you have become exceptionally skilled at learning spells. You can choose an additional spell list provided by the Draconian Spellcasting Lists. Starting at 14th level, you can choose an additional list to choose spells from.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Resistance
entries: Starting at 10th level, whenever you fail a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, as a reaction you can roll an additional time, choosing the highest result. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. At 15th level, instead of rolling you can choose to succeed instead.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 11th level, gain a feature from your chosen Draconian Archetype

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Awakening (x3)
entries: At 13th level, Gain another use of Draconian Awakening

classFeatures.name: Spell Expertise Improvement
entries: At 14th level, Choose another spellcasting list provided

classFeatures.name: Draconian Resistance Improvement
entries: Refer to the Draconian Resistance Feature

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 16th level, Gain a feature from your chosen Draconian Archetype

classFeatures.name: Draconian Awakening (x4)
entries: At 17th level, Gain another use of Draconian Awakening

classFeatures.name: Draconian Mastery
entries: Starting at 18th level, At 18th level, you have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will. Choose a 1st-level Dragon Mage spell and a 2nd-level Dragon Mage spell. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot when you have them prepared. If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Draconian Archetype Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Draconian Archetype

subclassFeatures.name: Devoted Spellcasting
entries: At 1st level you obtain an expanded spell list depending on the Dragon God you choose to worship or study. These spells are added to your Dragon Mage Spell Lists and count as Dragon Mage spells when you cast them.

entries.caption: Bahamut Spell List
rows: Bless, Cure Wounds, Healing Word, Sanctuary, Shield of Faith
Aid, Augury, Calm Emotions, Prayer of Healing, Lesser Restoration
Beacon of Hope, Daylight, Mass Healing Word, Revivify, Spirit Guardians
Banishment, Death Ward, Divination, Guardian of Faith
Commune, Greater Restoration, Mass Cure Wounds

entries.caption: Tiamat Spell List
rows: Arms of Hadar, Bane, Inflict Wounds, Wrathful Smite, Chaos Bolt
Blindness/Deafness, Crown of Madness, Silence, Spiritual Weapon, Phantasmal Force
Animate Dead, Bestow Curse, Hunger of Hadar, Speak with Dead, Summon Lesser Demons
Blight, Sickening Radiance, Staggering Smite, Summon Greater Demons

subclassFeatures.name: Divine Empowerment
entries: Also at 1st level, choose Bahamut or Tiamat, you gain one of the following abilities that correlates to what you picked. You can use each of these empowerments once per short rest. You gain another Empowerment at 6th level, another at 11th level, and finally one more at 16th level.

entries.caption: Divine Empowerment Spells
rows: Divine Blessing : If you were to fail a saving throw, as a reaction you can add 2d4 to the roll.
Divine Bane : If a creature were to succeed on a saving throw against one of your Dragon Mage spells, as a reaction you can subtract 2d4 from their roll.
Divine Healing : Whenever you heal a creature(s) with a Dragon Mage spell, as a reaction you can add an additional 2d4 to the roll.
Divine Harming : Whenever you would damage a creature(s) with a Dragon Mage spell, as a reaction you can add an additional 2d4 damage to the roll.
Divine Grace : When you would be hit by an attack you can, as a reaction you can add 2 to your armor class for that attack - potentially allowing the outcome to change.
Divine Peril: When you would miss an attack roll against a creature, as a reaction you can subtract 2 from their armor class for that attack - potentially allowing the outcome to change.
Divine Protection : Whenever you would take damage, as a reaction you can subtract 2d4 from the damage roll.
Divine Retribution : Whenever you would take damage, as a reaction you can deal 2d4 damage to the attacker. The damage is dependent on your Draconian Origin.

subclassFeatures.name: Divine Calling
entries: At 20th level, as an action you can call upon the powers of either Tiamat or Bahamut, upon doing so gives you one of the following benefits depending on whom you call upon for 1 minute. Once the effects end you cannot call upon the powers until after you finish a long rest.
[Bahamut] Aura of Blessing
You and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you gain a +2 to AC and Saving Throws.
Your healing spells heal an additional 2d6.
You and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you receives 2d6 less damage from any incoming damage once per round.
You and each friendly creature within 30 ft of you do not suffer the effects of difficult terrain.
[Tiamat] Aura of Destruction
Every hostile creature within 30 ft of you suffer a -2 to their AC and Saving Throws.
Every hostile creature within 30 ft of you receives 2d6 less hit points from healing spells.
Every hostile creature within 30 ft of you receives 2d6 more damage from your attacks and spells.
Every hostile creature within 30 ft of you suffers the effects of difficult terrain

subclassFeatures.name: Destructive Magic
entries: At 1st level, when you cast a Dragon Mage spell that deals damage it gains a bonus to the damage roll equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

subclassFeatures.name: Evoke Energy
entries: Also at 1st level you have a pool of energy that you’ll use for your Evoker Features called Evoke Energy. You have an amount of Evoke Energy equal to twice your Dragon Mage level. You regain all expended Evoke Energy after a long rest. As a bonus action on your turn you can spend your Evoke Energy to do one of the following effects :

Evoke Destruction : When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, by spending 2 Evoke Energy you can double the range of that spell and deal an additional amount of damage equal to 2 times the spell’s level. As a result, you suffer an amount of damage equal to the bonus damage dealt. You do not gain the benefits of any resistances or immunities to this damage.
Evoke Speed : When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher you can spend 2 Evoke Energy to cause you and all your allies within 30 ft of you to gain 10 ft of movement speed.

Evoke Durability : When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher you can spend 2 Evoke Energy to grant your allies within 30 ft of you also gain 10 temporary hit points, you yourself however do not receive that bonus.

Evoke Strength : When you cast an evocation spell of 1st level or higher, by spending 2 Evoke Energy to have allies within 30 ft of you gain advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws, you yourself however do not receive that bonus.

subclassFeatures.name: Evoke Aura
entries: Beginning at 6th level you can spend an action and 2 Evoke Energy to activate your “Evoke Aura”. Your Aura does not have a duration, however at the start of each of your turns you must spend 2 Evoke Energy to prolong the aura. While the Aura is active you have the following effects :

Each creature you choose within 30ft of you makes a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, on a failed save they are frightened for as long as the aura lasts, on a success they are immune to this effect for 24 hours. Each affected creature can repeat their save at the end of each of their turns, ending this effect on a success.

Creatures who are frightened of you have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws against Evocation spells you cast. In addition, creatures frightened of you cannot regain hit points if they are within your Aura’s radius.

You can choose a number of creatures within your aura’s radius up to your spellcasting ability modifier, those creatures gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half your Dragon Mage level at the start of each of their turns.
When the effects of your Evoke Aura ends you suffer 1 level of exhaustion and take 2d12 necrotic damage. Once you have used your Evoke Aura once, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Evoke Full Release
entries: At 11th level, as an action you can spend all of your remaining Evoke Energy to release a burst of energy outward 60 ft in every direction. This Energy will heal your allies within range 1d6 per Evoke Energy spent and deal 1d6 force damage per Evoke Energy spent to each hostile creature within range. When doing so, you take 2d6 damage per Evoke Energy spent. When you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. The damage you take ignores all damage reductions, immunities, and resistances. If you were to die as a result of this attack, your body and soul are destroyed. Only the means of the Wish spell can return you to life.

subclassFeatures.name: Evoke Control
entries: At 16th level, when you spend Evoke Energy on an evocation spell that deals damage, you can spend twice the amount you would normally spend to deal no damage to objects and allies within the range of the spell. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Evoke Mastery
entries: At 20th level, you have learned how to harness your Evoke Energy more efficiently, being able to call upon it more reliably. Whenever you roll initiative while you have no Evoke Energy, you regain 8. In addition, all of your Evoke Energy now restores after a short rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you gain the Druidcraft cantrip and one additional cantrip depending on your Draconian Origin damage type. You also learn how to speak, read, and write all dialects of Primordial. The damage provided by your Draconian Origin becomes known as your “Primordial Damage”.
*Original Cantrip, See below for details
Fire : Control Flames
Cold : Shape Water
Lightning : Control Sparks*
Acid : Shape Acid*
Poison : Poison Flow*
These cantrips do not count against your total known cantrips and count as Dragon Mage cantrips.
Original Cantrips:
Control Sparks :
Transmutation
Casting Time : 1 Action
Range : 30 ft.
Components : S
Duration : Instantaneous or 1 Hour

You create small harmless sparks of electricity. You can shape the strands of electricity in any way you see fit within range in a 5ft cube. You can use the sparks to ignite small objects, for example a cigarette, but never actually set it aflame. You can also surround yourself with these sparks and whenever a creature comes into contact with you, the sparks zap them as if it were static electricity. You can also use this feature to give a device active electricity for up to 1 hour.
Shape Acid :
Transmutation
Casting Time : 1 Action
Range : 30 ft.
Components : S
Duration : Instantaneous or 1 Hour

You choose an area of acid that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. 
You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the acid as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage and the acid being manipulated loses its damaging properties until released, which when released it deals 1d6 acid damage to a creature it is dropped on.
You cause the acid to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the acid’s color or opacity. The acid must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.
Poison Flow :
Transmutation
Casting Time : 1 Action
Range : 30 ft.
Components : S
Duration : Instantaneous or 1 Hour

Choose a poisonous substance nearby, whether it is in a vial, pool, bowl, drink, etc. You can magically move that substance freely within range. If moved into a creature, the creature can make a Dexterity Saving Throw, consuming the poison on a failed save. If a creature has a poison flowing through them, you can use this cantrip to remove the poison safely, without harming the creature who is poisoned. The creature must be within the range of the cantrip and must remain perfectly still so that the flow is not interrupted.

subclassFeatures.name: Elemental Supremacy
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals your Primordial Damage, you can instead deal the maximum amount of damage for the spell instead of rolling damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded down. You regain all expended uses of this feature after you finish a short rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Primordial Summons
entries: Starting at 11th level, depending on your Primordial Damage, you gain the ability to use the “Conjure Elementals” spell to summon that specific Elemental without requiring concentration on the spell or spending a spell slot. The Elemental lasts for the spell's normal duration and follows your commands as per the spell. The Elementals adopt the appearance of Dragons, but retain the original creature size.
Fire : Fire Elemental

Cold : Ice Elemental (Uses Earth Elemental stats but deals cold damage instead and the Earth Glide glides through solid ice rather than stone. It also replaces its Immunity to Poison damage with Cold.)
Lightning : Storm Elemental (Uses Air Elemental stats but deals lightning damage instead and replaces its immunity to Poison damage with Lightning instead.)
Acid : Acid Elemental (Uses stats for a Water Elemental but deals Acid damage instead and replaces its immunity to Poison damage with Acid.)
Poison : Poison Elemental (Uses stats for Earth Elemental but deals poison damage instead, but loses its Earth Glide feature.)

The Elementals follow the rules of the Conjure Elemental Spell and have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Primordial Transformation
entries: Starting at 16th level, as an action you can attain the shape of a Primordial. While in this state you gain the features of the Elementals you can summon as well as their slam attacks - which for the purposes of this transformation is the slam attacks are melee spell attacks. You retain your original features and stats, unless your Elemental has higher stats. This transformation lasts for 1 minute. Also depending on your Primordial Damage, you gain one of the following features while transformed in this way :
Fire : Flaming Weapons. Your weapons become magical for the purposes of overcoming magic resistances and are wreathed in flames, dealing an additional 2d6 fire damage.
Cold : Frozen Body. Your AC increases by 2 and you have advantage on all Constitution Saving Throws and your Slam attacks deal 2d6 cold damage.
Lightning : Shocking Retaliation. Whenever you are hit by a melee weapon attack, the source of the attack takes 2d6 lightning damage.

Acid : Melting Touch. Whenever you come into contact with an object, make a melee spell attack. On hit you deal 2d6 acid damage and the object begins to melt away. Depending on the size of the object it could take as little as 10 seconds to as long as 1 hour to melt away.

Poison : Toxic Touch : When you come into contact with a creature, they must make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC. On a failed save they become poisoned for 1 hour. They can repeat their saving throw at the end of each of their turns.
Once your transformation ends, you suffer 1 level of exhaustion and cannot transform again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Primordial Appearance
entries: Also at 16th level, rather than unleashing the might of the Primordial Transformation - you can assume the appearance of it at any given time, doing so however does not grant you the benefits of said transformation.

subclassFeatures.name: Primordial Lord
entries: At 20th level, you have mastered your control over the elements. You can now use your Primordial Transformation indefinitely and can permanently summon your Elemental as a companion, but can only summon one at a time. You also have advantage on Charisma checks with other Elementals, as they view you as a powerful Primordial.

subclassFeatures.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: Also at 20th level, whenever you deal your Primordial Damage it ignores all damage reductions, resistances, and immunities to that damage type. In addition, you gain “Absorption” to that damage type, which allows you to gain temporary hit points equal to the amount of damage you would have normally taken.

subclassFeatures.name: Manifest Dragon
entries: Starting at 1st level, as an action you can manifest a spiritual dragon. When you do so, the spirit has the stat block of a wyrmling corresponding to your Draconian Origin. For example, if you are a Red dragon mage, you manifest a Red Dragon Wyrmling. Your manifested dragon has a number of hit points equal to three times your dragon mage level, rather than the amount provided by the dragon’s stat block. Your manifested dragon also uses your proficiency bonus rather than its own. In addition, your manifested dragon is instantly destroyed if it is at least 30 ft away from you. Your manifested dragon is also destroyed if it falls to 0 hit points or fewer.

The manifested dragon shares its initiative with you, but cannot take actions unless otherwise commanded to as a bonus action. This command can be mentally given. In addition, while your dragon is manifested you can do any of the following:

When you take the attack action or cast a spell on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an attack originating from your manifested dragon using one of its attacks, or the spell can be cast originating from its position as if it had cast the spell. The spell still uses your own statistics when determining spell attack bonus and the spell save dc.
You can magically swap places with your manifested dragon using 15 ft of your movement, regardless of the distance between the two of you.

When a creature that you can see within 5 feet of your manifested dragon moves at least 5 feet away from it, you can use your reaction to make an opportunity attack against that creature using your manifested dragon as the attacker. Your manifested dragon cannot use their reaction when you do so until after the attack roll is made and the creature has left melee range of it.
You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Unleash Draconic Fury
entries: Also at 1st level, when you take the attack action or cast a spell while your dragon is manifested, your dragon can make a melee attack against a creature within 5 ft of it. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses after a short rest or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Manifest Greater Dragon
entries: Starting at 6th Level, when you use the Manifest Dragon feature, you can manifest a young dragon instead of a wyrmling. The same rules still apply, however the following changes are made:
Your manifested dragon can be up to 60 ft away from you without being destroyed.
Your manifested dragon loses any multiattack feature if it had one.
If you or an ally is within range of the manifested dragon’s breath weapon, they automatically succeed.
Your manifested dragon’s attacks are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming non-magical resistances.

subclassFeatures.name: Shared Mind of the Drakes
entries: At 11th level, you can now link with your manifested dragon’s senses. You can temporarily transfer your consciousness to your manifested dragon. As an action, you can see through your dragon's eyes and hear through its ears. During this time, you are deafened and blinded. You can sustain this effect for up to 10 minutes, and you can end it at any time (requires no action). While your manifested dragon is being used in this way, it can be up to 600 feet away from you without being destroyed.

subclassFeatures.name: Cooperative Initiative
entries: Also starting at 11th level, while your manifested dragon is summoned you have advantage on initiative checks. In addition, you can no longer be surprised by creatures as a result of being unseen by you, as your manifested dragon gives you a mental forewarning of incoming danger.

subclassFeatures.name: Manifest Superior Dragon
entries: Starting at 16th Level, when you use the Manifest Dragon feature, you can manifest an adult dragon instead of a young or wyrmling. The same rules still apply, however the following changes are made:
The dragon loses any of its legendary actions and legendary resistances if it had any.
The dragon gains a multiattack of two melee attacks and it can use its frightful presence as part of that multiattack.
The dragon loses any lair actions if it had any.

subclassFeatures.name: Mournful Sacrifice
entries: At 20th level, if you were to die by any means while your dragon is manifested, you can instantly destroy your manifestation and expend all remaining uses of your Manifest Dragon feature to avoid dying. When you do so, you are brought to your feet at 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeatures.name: Manifest Supreme Dragon
entries: Starting at 20th Level, when you use the Manifest Dragon feature, you can manifest an ancient dragon instead of an adult, young, or wyrmling. The same rules still apply, however the following changes are made:
The dragon’s multiattack increases to three attacks.
The dragon regains 1 Legendary Resistance.
The dragon’s AC increases by your proficiency bonus.
In addition, when you roll initiative while you have no uses of your Manifest Dragon feature, you regain 1 use.

There are many variations of Dragon Mages, Summoners who call upon the help of an inner spirit to come to their aid, Devoted whose magic is brought upon the study or worship of either Tiamat or Bahamut, Evokers who imbue power into their allies, and Primordials who further enhance their elemental attunement.
fluff.name: Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Sight of the Land and Seas
entries: You gain a tremorsense of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Claws and Fangs
entries: You gain 2 new additional forms of unarmed strikes. You have claws that, on top of your unarmed strike damage, gain an additional 1d6 slashing damage, and fangs that deal an additional 1d6 piercing damage. When you reach 5th level your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purposes of overcoming magic resistances.

optionalfeature.name: All Knowing Eyes
entries: You can cast Identify at will without expending a spell slot or requiring a material component, you also do not need to touch the item to identify it.

optionalfeature.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: You gain proficiency in Intimidation and have advantage on Intimidation checks. If you already have proficiency in Intimidation, you add double your proficiency bonus instead.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonsong
entries: You have advantage on performance and acrobatics checks. You gain proficiency in two musical instruments of your choice. As a bonus action you can begin singing your Dragonsong for 1 minute. While singing your song you gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Wisdom Modifier. You cannot use your Dragonsong again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Veracity
entries: If you move at least 30 ft in a straight line to a target you gain 1 additional weapon attack or unarmed strike. You can only make one additional attack like this once per round.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Minor Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 10 ft of blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. You cannot discern color while using your darkvision, only shades of gray.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Magi Drakes
entries: You can cast detect magic at will without material, somatic, or verbal components or spending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Breath Weapon
entries: Depending on the Draconian Origin you picked you gain a breath weapon that does 4d8 damage. The number of damage dice increases by 2 at 5th level, and then again at 10th, once more at 15th, and one last time at 20th level. You have a number of uses of this Draconian Power equal to half your Charisma Modifier (rounded down, minimum of 1) and regain all uses of it after a long rest. (Look at the Dragonborn Ancestry to determine the damage type). At 5th level the breath weapon increases to a range of a 30 foot cone or line depending on the type of dragon, 60 feet at 11th level, and 90 feet at 17th. The save DC for this power uses Constitution.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Rage
entries: As a bonus action on your turn you can enter a relentless rage for 1 minute. While raging you have resistance to non-magical slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage. In addition you receive a + 2 to attack and damage rolls.
You can choose to make your attacks at advantage but attacks made against you have advantage as well. Your rage ends early once you fall unconscious, are incapacitated, or die.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Sea Dragon
entries: You can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, attacks made underwater are made normally as if you were on land.

otherSummary.entry: Requires Gold, Green, Bronze, White, or Black Draconian Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Requires Gold, Green, Bronze, White, or Black Draconian Origins

optionalfeature.name: Magma Walk
entries: You no longer suffer difficult terrain from natural phenomenons on volcanoes, or anywhere where magma or lava is impeding movement. You can also walk on magma or lava without suffering damage and swim through it using a swimming speed if you have one or use half your movement. (You are not immune to fire damage, but you can traverse in hot areas to no difficulty) You can do so for 10 minutes without taking damage.

otherSummary.entry: Requires Gold, Brass, or Red Draconian Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Requires Gold, Brass, or Red Draconian Origins

optionalfeature.name: Sense Treasure
entries: You can detect whether or not gold or magical items are within 60ft of you, but not how much or where specifically. (not gold pieces, more like bars or large sums of gold.)

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Shield
entries: You no longer suffer from difficult terrain or negative effects from terrain impeded by acid. Also you can swim in acid using your swimming speed or half your movement. (You are not immune to acid damage, but you can traverse in acidic areas to no difficulty) You can do so for 10 minutes without taking damage.

otherSummary.entry: Requires Black or Copper Draconian Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Requires Black or Copper Draconian Origins

optionalfeature.name: Moderate Flight
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to 30 ft.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Tongue of Dragons
entries: You can speak any language so long as it has linguistic meaning and you have heard someone speak it before. You can comprehend any language spoken to you, but only as a rough translation, GM’s discretion.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Insight
entries: You gain a passive insight equal to 10 + your insight modifier. You can use this in place of a failed insight check

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Moderate Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 30 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. You can also discern color while using your darkvision.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Minor Draconian Shapechanger
entries: You can cast Disguise Self and Alter Self at will without concentration or material components or spending a spell slot. Alternatively you can cast polymorph at will without spending a spell slot, but it does require concentration.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Shapechanger
entries: You magically polymorph into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than half your own level. You revert to your true form if you die or if you fall unconscious or incapacitated. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (your choice). In the new form, you retain your alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, class features, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Your statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features of that form. You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your Charisma Modifier. Reverting back to normal does not expend a usage.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

otherSummary.entry: Requires Bronze, Silver, and Gold Draconian Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Requires Bronze, Silver, and Gold Draconian Origins

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of the Ancient Ones
entries: You gain proficiency in Arcana, History, Religion, and Intelligence Saving Throws. You also have advantage on Intelligence Checks. You also cannot have another “Ancient Ones” Draconian Power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Wisdom of the Ancient Ones
entries: You gain proficiency in Insight, Survival, Medicine, and Wisdom Saving Throws. You also have advantage on Wisdom Checks. You also cannot have another “Ancient Ones” Draconian Power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Strength of the Ancient Ones
entries: You gain proficiency in Athletics and Strength Saving Throws. You also have advantage on Strength Checks. Also whenever you make a grapple check you can move using your full movement instead of half. You can now carry triple the amount of weight before being encumbered. You also cannot have another “Ancient Ones” Draconian Power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Speed of the Ancient Ones
entries: You gain proficiency in Acrobatics, Stealth, Sleight of Hand, and Dexterity Saving Throws. You also gain advantage on Dexterity Checks. All of your movement speeds gain an additional 10 ft. You also cannot have another “Ancient Ones” Draconian Power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Charm of the Ancient Ones
entries: You gain proficiency in Persuasion, Deception, Performance, and add double your proficiency bonus to Charisma Saving Throws. You also gain advantage on Charisma Checks. You also cannot have another “Ancient Ones” Draconian Power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Endurance of the Ancient Ones
entries: You add double your proficiency to Constitution Saving Throws and gain proficiency in Death Saving Throws. You can no longer be intoxicated, poisoned, nor diseased. Once per long rest if you were to drop to 0 or less HP but not outright killed, you can drop to 1 instead. You also cannot have another “Ancient Ones” Draconian Power

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 60 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. You can also discern color while using your darkvision. You can now also see normally in Magical Darkness.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Draconian
entries: You gain advantage on stealth checks, while in dim light or darkness, you have resistance to all damage that isn’t force, psychic, or radiant. You can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Any damage dealt by your Draconian Origins or other Dragon Warrior Features (such as Draconian Powers) becomes necrotic damage. You have immunity to necrotic damage but lose the immunity from your Draconian Origin. You cannot choose Radiant Draconian or Ethereal Draconian while having this power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Draconian
entries: As an action you can dispel any magical darkness. You can do this a number of times equal to your charisma modifier. Any damage dealt by your Draconian Origins or other Dragon Warrior Features (such as Draconian Powers) becomes radiant damage. As an action you can touch another creature. The target magically regains 4d8 + your charisma modifier hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness. You can do this up to a number of times equal to half your charisma modifier. You regain the uses of both of those abilities after a long rest. You have immunity to radiant damage but lose the immunity from your Draconian Origin. You cannot choose Shadow Draconian or Ethereal Draconian while having this power.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Draconian
entries: You can see into the Ethereal Plane up to 120 feet. You can cast the Etherealness and Planeshift Spells without using a spell slot a number of times equal to your charisma modifier. (Both count for the expended uses.) You regain all uses of this after a long rest. Any damage dealt by your Draconian Origins or other Dragon Warrior Features (such as Draconian Powers) becomes Force damage, but only while on the Ethereal Plane. Your attacks always count as magical for the purposes of overcoming magic resistances but only on the Ethereal Plane. You gain resistance to force damage and retain your other immunities. You cannot choose Shadow Draconian or Radiant Draconian while having this power. (Note to GM : Feel free to disapprove if this does not fit in your campaign.)

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Hyperflight
entries: You have a flying speed of 60 ft.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of your choice that is within 120 ft. of you and aware of you must succeed on a Wisdom Saving Throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to your Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Form
entries: As an action on your turn, you polymorph into an Ancient variant of whatever dragon you chose for your Draconian Origin OR if you chose Radiant, Shadow, or Ethereal Draconian you become an Ancient variant of that. Your equipment follows the same ruling as Polymorph for the purposes of this ability. Your HP also applies the same ruling as per Polymorph. If you as the dragon drops to 0 hit points you revert back to normal and take whatever excess damage is leftover. After which you cannot use this ability again for 1d4 days and you suffer a -2 to your AC and 2 levels of exhaustion. After you use this feature you expand the usage of your Invoke Transformation feature.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Summons
entries: You can manifest two dragons at the same time, both of which follow the same rules. In addition, they gain an additional 20 hit points. When you use the Unleash Draconic Fury feature, you can make two attacks originating from either manifested dragon rather than 1

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Weapons
entries: Your bonded weapons now crit on a 19 or 20 and on a successful critical hit they add an additional 4d6 of the weapon’s damage type. In addition your bonded weapons ignore resistances and immunities to damage types caused by them.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Rider
entries: As a 1 hour ritual you can summon a Wyvern to use as a mount. This Wyvern is clad in scales corresponding to your Draconian Origin, so it gains your Draconian Scales feature. The Wyvern rolls its own initiative but can take commands as per normal. If you are riding the Wyvern, it can go before or after your own initiative (your choice). The Wyvern summoned in this way is friendly towards you and your allies, in addition it cannot be charmed or frightened. You can speak telepathically to the Wyvern and command it as a free action on your turn, but it loses any multiattack feature it had previously if you command it. If you do not command it, it acts on its own controlled by the DM. The appearance of the Wyvern is entirely up to you, so long as it is a functional flying mount. At 12th level your Wyvern’s stats and abilities change to that of a Young Dragon’s, but it also retains its Wyvern abilities and attacks. Once it has grown into a Young Dragon, it regains its multiattack feature. Its appearance can also change if you so desire. You can only have 1 Wyvern summoned at a time.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Shared Powers
entries: Your summoned dragons share the Draconian Powers that you possess that do not have the “Summoner Archetype” prerequisite. They also share your Draconian Origins abilities.

optionalfeature.name: Trained Body
entries: Through extensive training with your summoned dragons, your body has toughened even further. You gain an amount of hit points equal to your current level and each time you level up you gain 1 additional hit point. In addition you gain resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Persistant Allies
entries: Whenever a summoned dragon is within 30 feet of you they regain 5 hit points at the start of their turn as long as they have at least 1 hit point. In addition if they fail a saving throw while within 30 ft of you, they can spend their reaction to reroll that saving throw.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Friendship
entries: Your summoned dragons within 10 feet of you receives an increase to all saving throws equal to your charisma modifier, to a minimum of 1. At 10th level this becomes 30 feet, and at 20th level this becomes 60 feet.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Summon Companion
entries: As a 1 hour ritual you can summon a dragon-like humanoid with the stats of a Wyrmling corresponding to your Draconian Origins. The appearance and gender of this humanoid is up to you, but the scales on them correspond to your Draconian Origins. This companion is friendly to you and your allies and you can communicate telepathically to them. They also speak, read, and write all the languages you do. You can only have 1 companion at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Invoke Transformation
entries: As an action by spending 4 Invoke Energy you can transform your body into that of a Dragon’s. While transformed in this way you retain your skill proficiencies, saving throw proficiencies, ability scores that are higher than your transformed state, and class features. You gain the hit points of your new form along with any attacks or abilities by your new form except legendary resistance and legendary actions. In addition you gain any resistances or immunities from your new form. If you are dropped to 0 hit points or die in your transformation, the form is dropped. You can also end the transformation early as a bonus action on your turn. When your form is dropped you cannot transform again until after a long rest. At 8th level you can transform into a dragon of CR 4 or lower corresponding to your origin. At 14th level you can transform into a dragon CR 9 or lower corresponding to your origin. At 19th level you can transform into a CR 17 or lower corresponding to your origin.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Invoke Spirit
entries: By spending Invoke Energy you can create a pool of spirit energy that you can use to heal allies or empower yourself. Adding energy to the pool requires a bonus action, and healing an ally requires an action. 1 Invoke Energy adds 1 Spirit Energy to the pool, and you can only have a maximum number of Spirit Energy equal to your Proficiency Bonus. By spending 1 Spirit Energy you can heal either yourself or one ally within 30 feet 1d6 + your charisma modifier hit points. Alternatively you can spend 1 Energy point to roll a d6 and add that number to any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw - this can be done at any time when you make the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Invoke Dragon Eye
entries: By spending 1 Invoke Energy you can cast the true seeing spell without requiring concentration or material components or spending a spell slot.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Invoke Durability
entries: By spending 1 Invoke Energy, for 1 minute while you are conscious you also gain temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns equal to your charisma modifier, but not while you still have them. If you still have the temporary hit points but have less than your charisma modifier, you gain the difference.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Invoke Strength
entries: By spending 1 Invoke Energy, for 1 minute you can add your charisma modifier to all strength ability checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Mastery of the Blade
entries: When you make a weapon attack using a bladed melee weapon you can subtract 5 from the attack roll to increase the damage by 10. As a reaction you can impose disadvantage on 1 melee weapon attack aimed towards you. When you score a critical hit you add extra damage to the roll equal to your weapon’s main damage die. You cannot have this power if you have the Mastery of Archery power.

optionalfeature.name: Mastery of Archery
entries: The range of your ranged weapon attacks become twice the normal amount. Making a ranged attack on a prone creature or while within 5 feet of a creature does not impose disadvantage on the attack roll. When you make a ranged weapon attack and miss you can spend your reaction to make another ranged weapon attack, doing so gives you an advantage on the roll, however you do not add your proficiency bonus or ability modifier to the damage roll. You cannot have this power if you have the Mastery of the Blade power.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Awareness
entries: Once per round as a free action, you can spend 1 Draconian Spirit Energy to gain 1 additional reaction. If a melee weapon attack is made against you, you can spend a reaction to make a weapon attack against the attacker. If you hit, the attack made against you is made at a disadvantage.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Heart of a Dragon
entries: If you were to fall unconscious as a result of a poison or effect other than falling to 0 hit points, you can choose to stay conscious instead. After you use this ability you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. At 12th level you can do so twice per long rest, and at 18th level you can do so three times per long rest.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Dance of the Dragon Blade
entries: If you have made three or more melee weapon attacks on one target within your turn you can make 1 additional melee weapon attack against that target at advantage, afterward you gain the benefits of the dodge action. Doing so prevents you from taking your action next turn.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Arrow of the Soaring Dragon
entries: When you make a ranged weapon attack, instead of drawing an arrow from your quiver you can summon an arrow made of pure energy. Doing so does not require you to have ammunition. When you roll damage, instead of using your weapon’s normal damage roll you calculate the distance between you and the target. The damage equals 1d4 per 10 feet you are from the target. This damage does not gain the benefits of any damage modification, including your Dragon Warrior features.

optionalfeature.name: Coming of Age
entries: Your maximum CR for your Draconian Shape feature increases by 4.

class.name: Dragon Shaman

optionalfeature.name: Abberant Dragon
entries: You can replace your Draconian Arts damage type with psychic damage. This choice can be made before you roll damage. In addition, you gain resistance to psychic damage and as a bonus action you can establish a telepathic link to one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. This telepathic link allows you to communicate freely telepathically for up to twice the amount you could normally speak in the span of 6 seconds.

You are given two Warlock Spell Slots, see the Warlock’s “Pact Magic” feature PHB pg 107. Choose from two Eldritch Invocations (you must meet the prerequisites). You also gain the Eldritch Blast and one additional cantrip from the Warlock Spellcasting List. You also gain 4 spells from the Warlock Spellcasting List. These spells must be of a level of which you’d be able to cast as a 6th level Warlock.

As you gain Dragon Shaman levels, or if you choose this Draconian Power at a later level, you can replace the spells you know with other spells from the same spellcasting list. In addition, you learn 1 warlock spell for each dragon shaman level above 6th. You gain additional Warlock Spell Slot at 11th level, and another one at 17th level. You also gain an additional Eldritch Invocation at these given levels.

Your appearance also changes. Your body might have a coating of viscous slime, tough hide, scales, perhaps you have an invisible barrier or any other weird aberrant things your sick mind can come up with. As a result, this gives you an increase to your armor class equal to half your Intelligence modifier. (Rounded down to a minimum of 1)

class.name: Dragon Shaman

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the “Find Familiar” spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage

optionalfeature.name: Greater Draconian Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the “Find Familiar” spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon or a Faerie Dragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon or Faerie Dragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

class.name: Dragon Warrior, Dragon Shaman, or Dragon Mage
